content:
jessica Leggin Staff ReporterSeptember  

Justice.Guess shes not so blind after all read a sign yesterday at the Jena Six march PERIOD



The Jena Six are six black males in Jena La PERIOD who were charged of attempted murder for beating a white male student that was knocked unconscious PERIOD It was said the incident started when a couple of white male students hung nooses from a tree on Jena High Schools campus aimed at the black students PERIOD

The Eastern chapter of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People sponsored the march PERIOD

Markiana Jackson junior biology major and vice president of the chapter said the march was to raise awareness of racism and to support the males involved in the Jena Six PERIOD

Students came out and showed their support by wearing all black and holding signs that read Support Jena Six and Justice for Peace. during the march the NAACP took donations for the Jena Six cause PERIOD

Chae Frederick a sophomore psychology major decided to donate money while watching the students pass by during the march PERIOD

I heard the story and I feel rage Frederick said PERIOD

Frederick said there was no reason for the males in Jena to receive such a punishment because the six young men were provoked to take actions into their own hands PERIOD

Katherine Zike adviser for the Black Student Union said she was stunned about what is going on in Jena and hopes that everything will be resolved soon PERIOD

This is a great cause the students are doing by coming out and showing their support she said PERIOD

After the march around campus was over students and faculty went to seventh Street Underground to congregate and talk about issues such as racism PERIOD

Student Body President Cole Rogers said he hopes movements like the Jena Six continue PERIOD Movements talking communicating with one another and education is what is going to make a difference he said

Karen Armour a dietetics graduate student got up and spoke a few words at the meeting PERIOD

I was encouraged when I saw all the people who had came out and promoted a social change that is imperative to do so in todays society she said PERIOD

Maggie Burkhead adviser for the NAACP chapter told students what took place was very important PERIOD

We need to encourage and educate others about what is going on she said PERIOD

Some people do not know what is going on in Jena Burkhead said PERIOD

Burkhead wants the students to understand the importance of the march and how things will change for the better PERIOD

I hope the students as well as the faculty continue their support in the Jena Six she said PERIOD

Rick KambicSeptember  

EIU students march around campus in support of the Jena  PERIOD The march took place on Sept PERIOD  to raise awareness about the on going battle with racism PERIOD Karolina StrackThe Daily Eastern News
